newsitem.title: USA: CBOT March wheat drops to new contract low.
newsitem.headline: CBOT March wheat drops to new contract low.

text.p: CBOT March wheat dropped to a new contract low late on talk Egypt and India over the weekend would not buy U.S. wheat, traders said.
Traders said there were rumors Egypt will buy as much as 125,000 tonnes of Australian wheat and skepticism was mounting that India would buy any wheat from the U.S.
The new low for March was $3.60-1/2 per bushel as of 1252 CST, below the previous low of $3.63 set on November 6.
At 1253 CST, wheat was two to 8-3/4 cents per bushel lower, with March down 8-3/4 at $3.61-1/2.
